revised_title: Experimental Treatment of Trypanosomiasis: A Progress Report to a Committee of the Royal Society
tldr: The authors investigate the effectiveness of various treatments, including atoxyl, sodium antimonyl tartrate, and antimony, in treating trypanosomiasis in guinea pigs and rats. They also explore the use of antimony in a fatty medium for intramuscular injections, which may have implications for treating human trypanosomiasis.
